attributes.action: STOP THE PROPOSED NEW METHANE TERMINAL planned to be built and operated on Canvey Island
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The proposed terminal will store over 100,000 tons of L.N.G in two huge tanks. Both tanks will be over 130 feet high.

The proposed storage facility will store one fifth of the natural gas for the whole of England. This will pose a risk to Canvey and to areas well beyond.

If there was a leak (like Bunsfield), the liquid gas would freeze everything in its path. It would then boil off, evaporate and expand some 620 times, from a liquid state to a gaseous state, making it possible to be ignited from the slightest spark. This 
would cause an uncontrollable fire, for up to a 40 mile radius of Canvey Island.  The site of the planned plant is less than half a mile from housing.

Both the local and county council have rejected the plan. Do not let planning enquiry overrule local planning control
